New Records: Mikel Merino scored the latest winning goal in European Championship history
This was the first time Spain had beaten a host nation in a knockout tie at either a World Cup or European Championship
Key Match Events: Dani Olmo scored a beautifully-worked goal to put Spain ahead in the 51st minute
Florian Wirtz equalized for Germany in the 89th minute after a towering Joshua Kimmich header and a throw-in from goalkeeper Manuel Neuer
Mikel Merino scored the winner in the 119th minute to give Spain a 2-1 victory
Pre-Game Insights: Spain were considered the favourites to win the match
Germany's physical approach was expected to be a challenge for Spain
Toni Kroos was expected to play a key role for Germany
Post-Match Reflections: Spain coach Luis de la Fuente was pleased with his team's performance and said they deserved the win
Germany coach Julian Nagelsmann said his team was disappointed with the loss but proud of their performance
Toni Kroos announced his retirement from international football after the match
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in front of a packed stadium in Stuttgart, Germany
The weather conditions were good for the match
The referee was criticized for not giving a penalty to Germany in the second half of extra time
Others: Pedri was forced off the field with an injury after just 8 minutes of play
UEFA's yellow cards rule was criticized for being too harsh on Spain players
Spain's victory was seen as a significant milestone for the team
